channel.title: Docs on Workshop on GANs
channel.description: Recent content in Docs on Workshop on GANs

item.title: Workshop links
item.description: You're in the workshop right now! Enjoy! Learn! GANs 1: Exercises in the workshop These are the exercises provided for the Workshop on GANs Implementation of a GAN: Simple Gaussian MNIST GAN Dimitri’s serious stuff: Exercises Experiments Showcase, other experiments: Multi-dataset GAN We hope you have a good experience. Good luck. GANs 2 Theory slides Here you have the slides. Exercise notebooks These are the notebooks we will use during the second workshop on GANs.

item.title: Introduction to GANs
item.description: Warning, this page is a work in progress. Introduction to GANs This is a brief explanation of the Gaussian GAN example done during the workshop. If you want to jump stright to the code you can find it here take me to the code GANs are a type of generative models. That means that they try to learn the probability distribution of a dataset so they can can create new instances that look like the ones in the dataset.
